derivation.yuyuan_name: from Latin Vandalus, of Germanic origin. Sense 1 dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.tran: （尤指破坏公共财产的）破坏分子，捣毁者
entry.def: A vandal is someone who deliberately damages things, especially public property.

example.ex: All information systems that have been fitted at Ashford station have now been destroyed by vandals.
example.tran: 安装在阿什福德车站的所有信息查询装置如今都被破坏分子毁坏了。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who willfully destroys or defaces property

sentences.en: The seat-covers on the train had been ripped by vandals.
sentences.cn: 火车上的座位套子被破坏公物者故意撕破。

sentences.en: Car vandals caused more than 10 000 worth of damage to vehicles last Saturday.
